Key Match Events: Rassie van der Dussen smashed his 133 off merely 118 balls.
Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen set a 200-run second-wicket stand.
Keshav Maharaj ensured that the spinners had their say and struck four times.
Rassie van der Dussen scored his second century of the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa came out on top against close competitors New Zealand, recording their first win over the Kiwis since 1999 in the men's Cricket World Cup.
Marco Jansen's double strike lifted South Africa in the first Powerplay.
South Africa gained control of the Pune contest with wickets from Gerald Coetzee and Kagiso Rabada.
New Zealand lost three wickets in no time as South Africa bowlers exerted pressure.
Post-Match Reflections: Rassie van der Dussen was named Player of the Match for his brilliant 133.
Temba Bavuma expressed that the wicket was on the drier side and that the ball might skid in the evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa recorded their first win over New Zealand since 1999 in the men's Cricket World Cup.
Marco Jansen finished with 2/20 at the end of the first Powerplay.
Aiden Markram took a brilliant diving catch to end Devon Conway's stay at the crease.
South Africa hit a total of nine sixes in the final Powerplay.
Others: Tim Southee returned to the lineup in place of Lockie Ferguson, who was sidelined with an Achilles concern.
Kagiso Rabada came in for Tabraiz Shamsi after he missed the Proteas' recent match against Pakistan with a back problem.
